pylapp.smoothclicker.android

Class AbstractTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • pylapp.smoothclicker.android.AbstractTest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ItBrClicker, ItBrScreenOff, ItClickerActivity, ItIntroScreensActivity, ItJsonConfigExporter, ItJsonConfigImporter, ItNotificationsManager, ItPixelByPixelPicturesComparator, ItSelectMultiPointsActivity, ItServiceClicker, ItSettingsActivity, ItShakeToClean, ItStandaloneModeDialog, ItStatusBarNotifier, ItWakelockManager, UtATClicker, UtJsonConfigExporter, UtJsonFileParser, UtLogger, UtMissingJsonPointsFileException, UtNotificationsManager, UtNotSuitableJsonConfigFileException, UtNotSuitableJsonPointsFileException, UtPermissionsManager, UtShakeToClean, UtSoundNotifier, UtStatusBarNotifier, UtVibrationNotifier

    public abstract class AbstractTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to use to make UI tests with Espresso. We can make this kind if tests with Espresso or UI Automator. Espresso is less heavy than UI Automator and is for white-box-style tests and single-app testing. UI Automator is more for black-box-style tests, and for multi-apps testing. UIAutomator can reach some APIs or widgets (notifications, networks, etc.). You should see this site : http://testdroid.com/tech/top-5-android-testing-frameworks-with-examples Some samples here: https://google.github.io/android-testing-support-library/samples/index.html More about Espresso
    • http://developer.android.com/training/testing/ui-testing/espresso-testing.html
    More about UI Automator
    • http://developer.android.com/training/testing/unit-testing/instrumented-unit-tests.html#build
    • http://developer.android.com/training/testing/ui-testing/index.html
    • http://developer.android.com/training/testing/ui-testing/uiautomator-testing.html
    • https://github.com/googlesamples/android-testing
    Since:
    21/03/2016
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    pylapp
